zh-TW.title: 射日傳說（班級戲劇）
zh-TW.overview:
常有家長問：「為什麼慈心的戲劇課程這麼多？」這個提問，也常成為老師們反思的起點──在華德福學校裡，戲劇到底扮演了什麼角色？
對老師而言，戲劇不只是藝術表達，更是一段深具教育性的學習歷程。透過將課程內容轉化為戲劇展演，孩子不僅深化了對課程的理解，更能藉由肢體、聲音與情感的參與，整合內在的經驗與外在的表達。今年三年級的戲劇課，我們選擇了台灣原住民的《射日傳說》，並嘗試以台語音樂劇的方式演出。
zh-TW.innovation_summary: 這不只是一齣結合在地文化的台語音樂劇，更是一場「靈魂的煉金術」。我們摒棄了傳統以才藝為導向的選角，轉而實施「治療性選角」，將角色視為回應孩子內在需求的生命解藥——讓躁動者釋放能量、讓內向者練習發聲 。當戲劇不再執著於完美的演出，而是專注於內在的轉化，孩子們便能在協作中學會成全彼此，將舞台上短暫的掌聲，昇華為生命中真實而長遠的自信 。
zh-TW.innovation_question: 角色是為了成就完美的舞台，還是為了修補孩子的靈魂？

en-US.title: The Legend of Shooting the Suns (Class Drama)
en-US.overview:
Parents often ask: 'Why does Cixin have so many drama courses?' This question frequently becomes a starting point for teachers' reflection—what role does drama actually play in a Waldorf school?

For teachers, drama is not just artistic expression; it's a deeply educational learning journey. By transforming curriculum content into dramatic performance, children not only deepen their understanding of the material but also integrate internal experience with external expression through physical movement, voice, and emotion. This year's third-grade drama class features the Taiwanese indigenous legend 'Shooting the Suns,' presented as a Taiwanese-language musical.
en-US.innovation_summary: More than just a Taiwanese musical connecting with local roots, this course transforms the stage into a vessel for 'soul alchemy.' Moving away from talent-based casting, we implemented 'pedagogical casting,' assigning roles as remedies for each child's developmental needs—channeling excess energy into performance and transforming silence into courage. When drama shifts focus from artistic perfection to inner transformation, children learn to support one another, turning fleeting applause into genuine, lasting confidence.
en-US.innovation_question: Is the role meant to perfect the stage, or to mend the child's soul?
